subject: Re: [junit] How do I change the timezone used for the timestamp in the XML formatter?
msgSnippet: ... I don t remember enough XSL to know whether you can do that with XSL. If you can, then just change the stylesheet Ant s  formatter uses. Google will
messageBody:
lrdvadersith wrote:

> Currently, when I run JUnit 4 tests using the XML formatter, it puts a
> timestamp in each of the xml files. The problem is, it's the wrong
> time. I would like to use my local time instead of Zulu time. Is
> there a way to do this in my build.xml file?
>
> The TSTMP and TODAY values have my local time.
>
> Any ideas?

I don't remember enough XSL to know whether you can do that with XSL. If
you can, then just change the stylesheet Ant's <junit> formatter uses.
Google will give you the code-level details.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
